name: Layered Fruit Bars
author: Karla Essner
instructions:
Cream margarine, brown sugar, and vanilla in large bowl at medium speed of electric mixer until light and fluffy. Mix in flour and salt. Reserve 1⁄2 cup of mixture and 1 cup of quick rolled oats. Press remaining mixture evenly in ungreased 13 x 9 inch pan. Bake at 375° for 10 minutes.

Fillings
Lime-Cream Cheese: Beat 8 ounces of cream cheese, 2 table- spoons of lime juice, 1 egg and 1⁄2 cup granulated sugar until smooth. Spread over baked crust.
Cherry or Blueberry: Spread 1 can (21 ounces) desired flavor pie filling over baked crust.
Pineapple-Coconut: Combine two 8 ounces ounces cans crushed pineapple, 1⁄2 cup granulated sugar and 1 tablespoon cornstarch in medium saucepan. Cook on medium heat until thickened, stirring constantly. Stir in 1/4 cup chopped pecans, 1⁄2 cup flake coconut and 1 teaspoon lemon juice. Spread over baked crust.
Combine reserved mixture and rolled oats, mixing until crumbly. After filling is spread over baked base, sprinkle topping over filling. Bake at 375° for 15 minutes. Cool. Cut into bars, about 2 1⁄2 x 1 inches. Refrigerate.
